A block proposer in shard chain will Propose a New Block on Slot ( N + 1 )..

- When the Proposer of shard i proposes N+1 shard block, whose contents are decided entirely by a “proposer”. 

And as  he includes his opinion about Slot N Block of Beacon and Shard chain and then committee members provide attestations on his proposed data. then Committee members will have only option of not to attest if Block Proposer had proposed **wrong data** about Slot N Beacon or Shard block,

**A) He (Shard i block proposer) lies about the slot N of Beacon chain :** In this case, even if few committee members attest on his opinion, There will be other Honest block proposers , who had proposed the correct data and the attestation on their proposed blocks will also be included in the (N+1)th Beacon block 

Which will help in deciding the previous correct head of Beacon chain .. (with an assumption that more honest Block proposers than dis-honest one )

**B) If He (Shard i block proposer)  lies about the slot N of Shard chain :** In this case if few committee members of shards will attest the Dishonest Block proposer Opinion then in this scenario, Other honest shard Proposers data will not help as the dishonest had lied about his shard chain.

In such case i.e. B , is there any criteria of including or accepting the data about shard blocks with certain minimum attestations?

author: benjaminion
content:
> In such case i.e. B , is there any criteria of including or accepting the data about shard blocks with certain minimum attestations?
<@448487395189587969> I'm not totally clear on the question... For a shard's crosslink to be included in the beacon chain, 2/3 of the relevant validators must vote for it (more precisely 2/3 of the stake). If this doesn't happen, a crosslink will not be created for that shard in that slot - this is the case "failed beacon chain inclusion".

author: benjaminion
content:
Ah, Ok. I see. The failed beacon chain inclusion only applies if the block later gets enough votes - that is, if it just missed its slot but is otherwise good.

I think that if the next proposer doesn't like the block, it will build on the previous block instead and the bad block will be orphaned. It's as if the block didn't exist. But I haven't studied this in detail yet, but it should be in here somewhere: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase1/shard-transition.md
